metadata.title: CVE-2024-42249 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:spi: don't unoptimize message in spi_async()Calling spi_maybe_unoptimize_message() in spi_async() is wrong becausethe message is likely to be in the queue and not transferred yet. Thiscan corrupt the message while it is being used by the controller driver.spi_maybe_unoptimize_message() is already called in the correct placein spi_finalize_current_message() to balance the call tospi_maybe_optimize_message() in spi_async().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
